intro: Acrostichum ellipticum, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a prominent yellow center. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found near water bodies or in moist, shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in tropical and subtropical regions.
